whether an attempt to re-litigate matters already determined by the court

whether facts, matters and circumstances pleaded in respect of a claim under the australian securities and investments commission act 2001 (cth) (asic act) consumer protection provisions identical to facts, matters and circumstances pleaded in respect of an earlier claim under the trade practices act 1974 (cth) unfair practices provisions
whether, in the circumstances, any material differences between the legislation pursuant to which the proceedings are commenced
whether, in any event, "no reasonable prospects of success"
s 31a federal court of australia act 1975 (cth) bankruptcy
alleged counterclaim or set off for damages for financial loss and psychological or mental damage
whether counterclaim or set off actually exists

whether counterclaim or set off relies on facts, matters and circumstances previously before the court and previously dismissed held : substantive application summarily dismissed. nothing turns on the fact that the application in these proceedings is brought under the asic act as distinct from the trade practices act . claim is identical to that previously heard and determined by the court. to allow the application to proceed would constitute an abuse of process as an attempt to re-litigate a matter already determined by the court. further, and in any event, the application has "no reasonable prospects of success". no counterclaim or set off exists as the facts, matters and circumstances on which the claim for damages for financial loss and psychological or mental damage relies have already been dismissed.
